title: WCAS CHEM 210-1-02 Organic Chemistry
class_attributes:
Natural Sciences Distro Area

No separate laboratory or discussion course

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Chemistry 210-1 treats concepts fundamental to the study of organic chemistry, including structure, stereochemistry and reactivity. The chemistry of alkanes, alkenes, alkynes and alcohols is discussed in some detail as well.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Prerequisite: 103 or 172 (C- or better) or equivalent; AP score of 5; IB score of 7; or qualifying score on the Chemistry Placement Exam (available only to incoming first-year students).

Students do not need to enroll in a laboratory course. There is no laboratory course on CAESAR that is associated with Chemistry 210-1.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Organic Chemistry, 8th Edition, by L.G. Wade, Pearson ($309.40 new; $232.05 used)***
Turning Technologies Response Card Model QT or NXT ("Clicker") and associated license ($55) ###

***Prices as listed by the Northwestern Norris Bookstore (6/14/16). Course materials may be available from other vendors at lower prices.

### The clicker will be used in weekly lab lecture. You will also need a clicker for the 230-2 and 230-3 lab courses in Winter and Spring.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
Solutions for Organic Chemistry, 8th Edition, Jan Simek, Pearson ($160 new; $120 used)***
Molecular Modeling Kit ($41.15 new; $30.85 used)***

***Prices as listed by the Northwestern Norris Bookstore (6/14/16). Course materials may be available from other vendors at lower prices.
